title: William Klein, Who Photographed the Energy of City Life, Dies at 96
description: He built his reputation with dreamlike images of New York, Rome, Moscow and Tokyo and cast a satirical eye on fashion in a decade of work for Vogue.
dc:creator: Robert D. McFadden
media:credit: William Klein/Howard Greenberg Gallery, New York
media:description: “Self-portrait” (1998) by William Klein. Born in New York, he found his home in Paris, where he defied traditions and plunged into his anarchic visions of painting, sculpture, street and fashion photography, feature films and documentaries.
